website_summaries.verdict: A really incredible value on this spinning reel that performs consistently.
pros: Can last through salt water with proper care
Feels more expensive than what you will pay
Works well when the water is colder
cons: While this works in saltwater, you need to remember to clean it before storage for long periods of time, or you might find it seized up

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight reel but needs a lower cost for a second spool. I just bought a second reel.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the first one so much i just bought a second one. Liked the quality, finish, smoothness and the solid feel. Only thing i disliked is the cost for an extra spool. I loaded it with 6 lb braid for small fish but i also want to load it with maybe 10 or 12 lb test for bigger fish. I called customer service for another spool and the price was $12. The price for the reel was only $22. Why can't Kastking add a second spool and raise the cost a little? Just not more than half...
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: A solid spinning reel
customer_reviews.text: I am not a big fan of spinning reels in general, but I know there are certain applications I have to have them for. So, I picked up the Summer, thinking - I'm not spending too much money on it, so I'm okay with that. But, I am pretty impressed with this reel. It feels really solid and the drag is stout. I also like the push button to collapse the handle. Overall it seems like a great reel.
customer_reviews.author: Beckie GaskillTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, feels good in your hands
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, feels good in your hands, and spins smoothly for under $25!!!! Time to spool some 30lbs braid, and pair it with my 10’ Hurricane BlueFin and hit the waters! Rod and reel under $100! You can’t beat that! I have more expensive rods and reels, that I hardly use because I’m afraid to leave them in the car! Where I live isn’t the best as far as leaving things in the car, lots of break ins.. so I keep my other stuff handy and I’ve grown to love the lower budget stuff. Companies like KastKing are making real quality stuff at damn good prices! I’m happy! I’ll update later with a performance review..
customer_reviews.author: Jaycode415

customer_reviews.title: ... looking for a high quality low price reel that's easy to use then this is the reel for you
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a high quality low price reel that's easy to use then this is the reel for you. not only does it look and feel like high quality but with up to 20lbs of drag it also high performance. If fishing is your passion then this reel is a must have
customer_reviews.author: reggie diaz

customer_reviews.title: It must be good if I'm willing to try something besides my trusty ...
customer_reviews.text: Officially buying my 2nd one after my son who swears by his. It must be good if I'm willing to try something besides my trusty Penn 4400 that I've been using the last 20 years. Here he is with his 32 inch Snook caught without ant issues. Take care of it and it will last is what I've told my son, and apparently it has lasted. I first laughed when he told me it was a reel that costs less than 30 bucks, figuring it would be broken within the 1st 2 trips on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Network Tech

customer_reviews.title: I HIGHLY recommend for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I give this reel 5 stars because of the price. I really don't think you can get a better reel for $25. My friends have nick named this reel "White Lighting," and we've pulled in all kinds of BIG fish.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Potts

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews seemed good with this brand. I was really hoping to find a brand that can be on par with the penns or shimanos. I was in love with it on my first time out. I cleaned it up and put it on my rod rack. Next week when I went to take it for another spin and I found the shaft rusted. I only used it once 😥 my diawa saltist that my son was using got the same treatment that day and it works as good as the day I bought it. Sad part is I spent the day bragging.
customer_reviews.author: Biviana Arroyave

customer_reviews.title: Not Smooth at ALL!
customer_reviews.text: Save some coins and go with (China Brands) Thekuai 1000 or Himalayaplus 1000. You can shop them as cheap ad $7-15. They are smooth. I paired the Kastking with my St Croix Panfish Rod. Great rod - Shixy reel. I paid $7 for a Himalayaplus 1000. It's all metal gears and copper shaft. This Kastking has gear teeth that are off/busted right out of the box. I've got to waste my time returning it...
customer_reviews.author: Darrell W Taylor

customer_reviews.title: AN AMAZING reel for its price
customer_reviews.text: AN AMAZING reel for its price .... i got this as a starting reel for my 6 year old son.. he loves it !! and he even caught 2 fish on his first ever time using a reel:) you will be amazed at how good this reel is !!! i bought the 2000 series .. the drag was good for its size ... i will for sure try the rest of the reels made by this company... feels like $90 reel :) for one third the price .
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mahmoud Al Aasar

customer_reviews.title: Reel drag tangles like
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never owned a reel that wrapped the line within the drag spool until I purchased this reel. It’s a good sized reel and a bit bigger than I expected but I wouldn’t order another one. Just about every 100th cast I have to cut my line and retie because the line wraps around the drag spool and creates a round “nest” of tangles. If I purchased cheap line maybe I could understand or if I hadn’t operated an open faced reel then maybe. Must be a flaw in the reel I have since I didn’t read this prior to purchasing. The bait casting reel I have from this company is terrific. This is open faced is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Tash

customer_reviews.title: ... going to be fishing from shore you will be fine. I was fishing from the surf and a ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to be fishing from shore you will be fine. I was fishing from the surf and a small wave hit my reel and nothing happened until a few days later that I realized that it did not want to turn. I added some lube and cleaned it really well with WD-40 and it sort of helped but it was not as smooth as when I bought it. When you wind the handle down it'll feel like you're pulling something very heavy. Extremely disappointed in that this reel didn't last long for me. Most reels I have get splashed with salt water and will still work. This does not.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Smooth for $20, but a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: Pros: smooth, body has quality feel, excellent with braid, the 2000 size easily horses 5lb bass, the retrieve ratio is fast enough to bottom fish for bass. Cons: hardware is beginning to corrode. The set screw holding the handle is already corroding and I fish strictly freshwater with it. I love this reel, but after one season I don't see the original hardware lasting much longer. Also, the drag is glitchy. I set the drag and forget it, yet some days it "locks" down and I really have to play with it for the drag washer to slip again. I would get the saltwater series even if you fish freshwater if just to avoid the corrosion alone.
customer_reviews.author: Inform

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Reel
customer_reviews.text: Awesome reel; Real performer and a real looker and very smooth, I only wish that KastKing would offer extra spools here on Amazon packed with the drag clutches ready to use with your other line. Good Job KastKing keep these great reels coming as we appreciate these awesome products.
customer_reviews.author: greengoose

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: I guess one always has to consider the price paid when writing these reviews. Considering this reel cost me about $17, this is deserving of more stars than Amazon allows. This reel is worth at LEAST twice that if not 3X as much. Great little spinning reel. I will be using this for inshore saltwater stuff on a ML rod. Fit about 250 yards of 10lb KastKing braid on there. Smooth, drag is middle range (about what I expect from a $70 reel), good bearing count for a reel of this range, overall pretty great. Buy it, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: HHOMedia

customer_reviews.title: Line never spools evenly, even after respooling.
customer_reviews.text: Everything looked good out of the box, but as soon as I started loading line on, I noticed why this is sooooo cheap. The line does not spool evenly. It is spooled in a cone shape concentrating the line toward the top of the spool. When you go to the cast, the line gets stuck under each other and stops your bait in mid-air. I even respooled new line and the exact same problems occurred. Date night sucked as she got frustrated because of this reel.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Inoperative worm gear
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel knowing it wasn't expensive, but without worm gear engaged-useless. I took the reel apart, (like many, before using,) and, from what I can tell, there has to be a piece missing or something. I bought two. One works well, the other a paper weight. I guess I will keep the spool for a spare and toss the rest of reel in the trash. Buyers beware, and test thoroughly right out of the box, and make necessary contacts with shipper/seller/maker.
customer_reviews.author: Willy T.

customer_reviews.title: Get out and fish!
customer_reviews.text: Beginner angler here with a beginner opinion... but I ordered three different types of 2000 series reels and of the three, KastKings product outshined them in every category. From easy set up, to easy operation this reel is perfect to get you started. The other reels were low geared, cheap plastic quality, or were just heavier than the KastKing. Now I’m only three reels deep and so far I’ve caught fish over and over again on this new set up. Pair this with a nice KastKing rod and you will be set for an amazon fishing starter kit. While your at it, buy line, you will want to fish the second you get this thing in the mail! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Kat W.

customer_reviews.title: Came with a small crack (bail area)
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to using this reel next weekend, but it came with a small crack near the bail (hard plastic). I have not heard back from the seller and am going to ask Amazon for resolution. I can easily return it and get another reel, but wanted to see what customer service the seller has and I also contacted KastKing. Will edit this or let you all know. Keep fishing! kl
customer_reviews.author: ArchitectBingo_kl

customer_reviews.title: Love this reel
customer_reviews.text: I needed a spinning reel to replace my old Quantum cheapie from Walmart. Having bought a Kastking baitcaster, I checked out their spinning reels. I decided on the Centron for the number of bearings and the price point. Boy, I love this reel. It's a smooth as butta'. I bought the 3000 and loaded it with 8lb test. I paired it with the Perigee rod and it's a beauty. The drag is smooth, flip the handle and it spins for days. I liked it so well I bought the 2000 also.
customer_reviews.author: Steven McPeak

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've fished this reel heavily in rivers for salmon over the last few months. No problems with large coho and chinook, down to small native trout. Spooled with 30lb braided line and a 12lb leader and it runs great. I fish in the rain and the reel has been dunked in the river a few times during crossings and still running smoothly and catching fish. Very impressed with how smooth this reel is for the price. I will be looking at higher quality models from KastKing in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Dom Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great reel! Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I actually returned this, but not because of the lack of quality. It actually seemed to be a solid reel for the money. I was just looking for something lighter to put on my collapsible pole when I'm backpacking in the backcountry. It was totally my fault for not reading the specs on the weight and size. If I was just fishing under normal conditions, I'd be proud to own one of these reels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Casts like an ultralight with the stopping power of a baitcaster!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I cannot believe the quality of this reel. It is really cool looking too! I bought the 3000 model and put 12 lb. braided line on it. I cannot believe how far the line travels with just a flick of the wrist. I love the fact that this reel has instant anti-reverse for setting the hook. As soon as that bail goes closed, there is zero reverse movement. I am now considering other weights of this same model.
customer_reviews.author: Burton R. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable value. Really surprised.
customer_reviews.text: This reel is amazing. Reminds me of my former favorite brand sh**ano. This is silky smooth and quiet. Looks sharp and is built more durably than I expected. Unfortunately, I bought the 500 when I thought I was ordering the 5000. I will be keeping the 500 for my stream trout rod. I also ordered the 5000 for pier fishing this fall for salmon. 4 stars instead of 5 because I haven't actually used it yet but I can tell quality when I see it. This reel could sell for 20$ more easily. Get them before they come to their senses!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, smooth, great for panfish.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed,lined it with flourcarbon 4 lb. test, 5-5' ultra light rod for fast action. Make sure you use premium mono, not too stiff, has good stretch and cast ability, I use it for jigging plus can cast 1/16 jigs so 4 lb. mono is best suited for line shy fish in clear water. I liked it so much I bought two more, plus two identical rods to match the first one. I use all three with different color jigs, two for jigging and one ready to cast out.
customer_reviews.author: vee99

customer_reviews.title: Amazing reel for the price
customer_reviews.text: This reel has been amazing for the price. After using Penn reels for years costing x3-x4 times as much I decided to give the KastKing reel a try. I've used their line for years and have been generally happy with it. Picked up the 2000 for about 40 bucks and had low expectations but figured it would be good enough for basic panfish. It turns out this reel has taken the place of my other spinning reels. Casts extremely smooth and the retrieve rate is quick. Amazing value for the price. Had such a good experience I'm going to try their baitcaster next.
customer_reviews.author: SvenTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not built to last
customer_reviews.text: worked great for about three or four fishing trips and then got a bad spot in the gearing, that caused it to hang-up and get real hard to turn the handle about every four or five rotations. very annoying. Unfortunately it is past the 30 day Amazon return policy so I guess I am stuck with this piece of junk. I thought was a good deal. my bad.
customer_reviews.author: GRB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing reels
customer_reviews.text: Have both the 500 and the 2000 guess they made the 500 a lil larger than an ultra light reel (able to hold more line) well needless to say I loved the 2000 so I bought the 500 and also bought the kast king resolute rod and it’s an amazing combo for the price both reels seem really solid I mean I used to burn through Walmart reels about every year with ultra light setups and this has a 1 year warranty then also signing up for there vip program which is free they extend that warranty another year I think kast king is my go to company for now on
customer_reviews.author: ronald flood

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these reels for surf fishing only had them out one time, the button on the reel handle for storage does not lock as it should. Ever time I had to reel in bait or a fish the reel handle kept folding over on it's own because it would not lock firmly. Buy the centrion instead have had better luck what those reel. The summer is junk!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Herbertson

customer_reviews.title: So far love them
customer_reviews.text: Reel looks nice, I even had a compliment on the pier about its looks. I ordered 2 of the 4000 series to take to Okaloosa pier on my week vacation, both functioned extremely smooth with no issues at all, I fished every day and caught lots of lady fish , Bonita, and Spanish mackerel, I used 20# mono on one 30# on the other throwing bubble rig with 30# florocarbon leader, I'm confident this reel would handle anything the average guy could throw at it. I'm getting ready to order the 5000 for next year, I did have a large bonita break my 7' Fenwick in half but still landed the fish.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Centron is Good reel, not too slow...perfect for jigging.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, super deal at current price It might be a slower ratio, but sometimes you want that...for jigging and more finesse presentations. Certain crankbaits also do better with a slightly slower retrieve, Especially when the water is colder. UPDATE: I just got another one and they got rid of the paddle knob, which I hated, thanks for doing that. The newer models with the black more standard knob is far better.
customer_reviews.author: Snorkel

customer_reviews.title: not worth it even if you get it for free
customer_reviews.text: Did not like the reel, just didn't work right, took forever to retrieve my bait on the 2000, had broken lines with drag being too tight, lost fish on the hookset for the drag being too loose, never had problem with any reel. Pay a few bucks more and stick with Quantum and Shimano reels. Had to return product and get refund, I will stick with my Quantum and Shimano reels, best in the world. And even their cheapest ones are waaaaaaaaaay better then the most expensive one here.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Superb Quality ! Reviews tell the facts ! Base your opinion on them !
customer_reviews.text: A Great Reel for the money , well built , smooth operation ! I used the 2000 model for trout fishing in the mountains of NC. and caught several 1 lb 6oz Rainbows including one Nice 2lb 2oz Rainbow on this Reel , it worked like a clock ! Thanks KingCast for a well made Reel ! Hopefully with proper cleaning and maintenance it will last for years to come !
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality with short durability
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my 8 yr old girl after reading all the positive reviews. The reel stopped working after two fishing excursion. I made sure to wash it off with water after both time since I live in Hawaii and fish in saltwater. I would never buy this brand. It feels like a cheap plastic Chinese stuff.
customer_reviews.author: sonlds2002

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: The handle feels really cheaply made. The whole reel feels like it would break. But you know what? It handles like a champ. I paired it with my med-heavy Berkley rod, put runcl braided line on the reel and put it to the test. I used it for saltwater fishing, and it really handled everything I threw at it. Pulled in 2lb fish, no problem, snags, no problem. Fish after fish after fish, it was awesome. I would definitely buy again. I can't say how long this reel will last, but, with the regular care I usually do, I feel like it will last a long time. Wow. Awesome. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: SDF1

customer_reviews.title: I don’t think I can write enough good things about this reel
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think I can write enough good things about this reel. I put it on a Berkley rod and took it out fishing to see what it would hold up to. Started off catching nice snapper and this reel performed flawlessly. I set the drag a little low just in case I caught something bigger. Drag is smooth and easy to change on the fly. Later in the day I caught 2 really nice redfish with this reel. Reel is so amazingly smooth when catching bigger fish. I have 20lb braid on this reel which has made for the perfect combo. His is hands down one of the best reels I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Deal in Ultra Light Reel!
customer_reviews.text: Greatest deal in ultra-light! I’ve been fishing Shimano for over 30 years. That’s all I used. I’m here To tell you KastKing is going to blow the high end fishing market away! This Centron 500 Ultra Light Spinning reel is amazing. I put it up to Shimano anytime. Smooth drag excellent retrieve. With 9+1 bearings and very good quality parts what a deal. It’s $22.00 a fraction of the cost of Shimano Nasci 500. Do yourself a favor buy a KastKing reel and put it up against your go to reels you’ll find that your going to have a New go to reel!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: It’s “ok”, expected better from kast king but you get what you paid for. It looks good but I paid $10 more for a tight line “ cabelas brand “ and it feels way more secure and feels better made then the Kast King. I bought the 4000 and it can definitely cast far with a 12 ft rod and 50lb braid, but it feels like it struggles on bigger fish, and the “handle grip” on the arm feels cheap and flimsy when trying to reel in a 2oz sinker
customer_reviews.author: Tj Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very nice reel for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this reel. I have purchased several and each of the reels have been very smooth. These reels are a bargain for the price. I cannot comment on the durability of this reel because I have not been using it long enough. However, even if the reel only lasts a few years I will have gotten my money's worth several times over. Lastly, the Centron looks very nice because the fit and finish is well above what you would expect for a reel of this price.
customer_reviews.author: RaidenS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Haven’t even made one cast yet but just the feel alone I already ordered another!
customer_reviews.text: Just got my centron 2000. Feels real smooth. In fact it feels smoother then my pflueger pres 30. Both brand new. I almost want to return the pres and get a centron 3000 instead. I’ve already ordered another centron. Size 500 for a micro UL setup. Visually it looks great. The black and blue color combo work well together. Appears solidly constructed. Has a nice tall spool. Really want to rate this five stars, have to see how it performs in action. I’m almost positive I won’t be disappointed. Will update review end of April after the trip I bought this for. Hoping it brings in some slabs. Have good expectations of this reel. Time being four stars.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Will catch fish.... for a day. Then into the trash
customer_reviews.text: This reel landed me a couple of nice snook. I thought I got myself a bargain. After a thorough wash when I got home I packed it away until my next fishing trip. Unfortunately the reel is clearly made out of the cheapest components (not surprised due to low cost) and was unusable after just one fishing trip. If you are fresh water fishing I guess you are fine, but if not, might be best to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Nelson

customer_reviews.title: KastKing Spinning Reel
customer_reviews.text: I have used the KastKing baitcasting reel before they were solid and smooth, this is my first spinning reels from Kastking. I have taken the reels out a couple times salt water fishing. It might not be a good idea, I wash my reels everytime but the salt water seems to affect the performance of the reel. Bottom line, reel is smooth, cast alright with my 25LB braided line. Hope it will hold up my abuse with salt water sneakhead fishing!
customer_reviews.author: Cheng W.

customer_reviews.title: I truly think this may be the best reel for its price
customer_reviews.text: Other than putting on new line I have yet to use this however so far it looks to be made of very high quality. Also it is very smooth however for this many bearings I was expecting a bit more smoothness however at this price point I can't knock it a star for that. I truly think this may be the best reel for its price. We will see how it holds up to fish this weekend and I will edit the review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Shalini

customer_reviews.title: Reel broke after using twice
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to try out this reel. Actually it’s a pretty good reel but the quality is something to be desired. Reel is not working after the second time out. Contacted Kastking and left several messages that I would be happy to send in the broken one for a new one. Don’t they have some sort of warranty? I have yet to receive a call back. Shame on you, Kastking. Terrible customer service. Guess I’m back to Shimanos.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: Is absolutely the best value for someone wanting more than a Wal-Matt brand rod and reel but still learning. Great value, smooth casting and easy set up. Can be switched from left to right hand or attached to various rods. I used this on an ultra light rod with 2 lb test line for trout fishing and it worked amazing. Perfect casting and such fun catching trout and fighting them in. Allowed me to adjust setting and play with the fish so the line didn’t break but provided enough give to wear out the fish and real in nice trout all day long! Ended up buying another in white for a second rod set up!! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: THE 3000 SERIES
customer_reviews.text: I have at least 4 KK reels and today I spooled all of them up to be ready for the COHO run that is just starting here in the PNW. I do hope the others (especially the level wind reels) look better that the spinners, which look kinda junky and the spool material is very easing chewed up if mis-aligned on change out.. Maybe it is just a matter of spending more money, but if they fail me on this first try with 2 LW and 2 SPIN, then I may not get any more and go back to SHIMANO/DIAWA/QUANTUM/ABU/PFLUEGER for more money. I know those work
customer_reviews.author: Daxenoz

customer_reviews.title: Buy Something Else
customer_reviews.text: I've always been Shimano reel fan, but the looks and reviews of these Kastking rods and reels had me intrigued. I thought I'd take a chance and I ordered three different reels for an upcoming fishing trip. Unimpressed and disappointed was the only way to describe these reels. Flimsy plastic feel. This Summer model was so bad that I'm returning it today. It will barely spin and feels like it's turning on a sanding wheel. Not the smooth reliable action that I'm used to. Buy a reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Layne Galyean

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with all of my kastking fishing reels. This SUMMER feel is fantastic .
customer_reviews.text: Very nice reel compared to one of my more expensive ones. This one out preformes it no problem I lined it with some of kastking super power braid 15lb test. And I can say no. Complaints here works very nice my lews 7' rod I'm very happy with my purchase I now own several KASTKING. Reels and am very happy with them
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: VERY SATISFIED
customer_reviews.text: Love the reel! It's smooth action and tight, firm bail make this a go-to reel for light to medium trout, crappie, bass, and lake perch fishing. I rated it only four stars because I haven't used it long enough to judge the durability. I suspect, that with proper maintenance, this reel will be handed down to my great, grandkids someday to the chagrin of my grandkids today.
customer_reviews.author: EDinWAState

customer_reviews.title: Great way to lose lures
customer_reviews.text: Only have one gripe with this reel, and it's a big gripe. When you open the bale to cast, there is a good chance that your line will be pulled down around the bale and snag as you cast. I've had many spinning reels, and this is my first time encountering this problem. I've lost many of my lures due to this flaw. I miss my rectangles n stinkers.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Gearing Broke First Use...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife as a cheap travel reel. Bail barely worked outta' the box, never broke in. After, guaranteed, less than 8 hours fishing, something broke inside the reel body, feels like the gears let go inside. I know this is an inexpensive reel but, I'd like a refund/replacement. Reel was not abused/misused. Have had other KastKing stuff that didn't implode after first use. Shoulda' just bought another Daiwa BG. Let's see what happens with response to this review........ hopefully I can at least leave an update on top notch customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Customer support😔
customer_reviews.text: Honestly i cant even tell if the reel is good or bad I bought one and saved for my nephew , Then he came 5 month later to visit me I have promised him to taken fishing when i installed the reel in the fishing rod The reel would spin both way not stopping meaning it was defective Making a mess of the fishing line every time he try to cast, I contacted customer support and they ask me to send it back me paying the shipping cost witch will cost me more than the reel itself Maybe the product was good but not the customer support
customer_reviews.author: aldo c.

customer_reviews.title: Cool reel; just don't dunk in water.
customer_reviews.text: Purchase the summer 5000 model reel as a backup saltwater reel for Kayak fishing. Hook a medium size Bonita on 20lb test braid; drag system work great; wash all gear down and left outside over night. a small storm front pass through dumping a lot of rain. following weekend reel was not as smooth as it was before Small hole in the rotor shell near hex nut; ( under the spool ) allow water to hit the un-shield bearing in the locating device. had to clean and re-lube the bearing. the pack the small hole by the nut with grease. All and All cool reel for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I Just Ordered A Third
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 Centron 500 and have used them heavily. They would be a bargain at twice the price — I can think of nothing to say that would do this product justice. Smooth operation, reversible handle, excellent drag adjustment. I wouldn’t change a thing about it. Just ordered a Summer 2000 in preparation for throwing some heavier lures this spring. I have fished for trout, panfish and bass and it handled a 22 1/2” largemouh on 6lb test line without issues. Amazing bargain for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: rshower2

customer_reviews.title: Frozen bearings!
customer_reviews.text: The bearings froze after use in salt water and a proper rinse with fresh water. These bearings are not stainless steel. They appear to be mild steel. My reel is now useless.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: Love my Centron 3000!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am VERY impressed with my new Centron 3000 on also my new KastKing Perigee II 7'Med 2-piece FA rod. On just my second cast with the new setup, I caught a nice 2lb bass using 20lb Spiderwire Moss Green braid and a 10lb Berkley Vanish Flurocarbon leader. Lure used was a Owner Ultrahead shaky type 3/32oz shakyhead with a Googan Baits drag-n-drop 4" Brown Gill. Can't wait to see what else I can catch with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Montemayor

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Light/Moderate Use
customer_reviews.text: I have the 500 size reel. It saw heavy use as my Ned Rig reel for about a year. My only issue with this reel is best seen in the picture. The handle is metal, while the handle seat that attaches the handle to the rest of the reel is plastic. The metal handle hitting against the plastic at the joint caused the plastic to break, making the handle wobble and hit against the reel bail. I would NOT recommend this reel for heavy use. I would recommend this reel for light/moderate use, or as an entry-level reel for beginner fishermen. The drag is amazing, and the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: L Plank

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk!! I have used this reel on 1 occasion and the bail slams closed mid cast every time. Luckily I had 3 poles with me or the trip would have been ruined. Look for a name brand reel and skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine E. Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Customer service please read and respond
customer_reviews.text: The reel looks nice but the first time i used it and was bringing in a large fish the black plastic piece on the end of the handle broke. I had to reel in my old pole and take the handle from it to finish reeling in my catch. If the customer service could get a hold of me that would be great i just need a new handle. The reel was $35 and i expect a lot better quality considering i could have got a Abu Garcia from walmart and only spent $5 more.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Well built reel.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a reel built to last for quite awhile. I haven't opened it up to see how much plastic is inside but it hasn't given me any problems fishing weekly in fresh water. I purchased the centron model because I wanted the lightest available. This reel is very smooth on retrives and casts a long ways. I think it is a really good reel for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap reel
customer_reviews.text: Great cheap reel. Use it in saltwater for Trout/Redfish. Drag is sufficient to stop most everything I catch. Reel is smooth. Can’t complain for the price. Owned it 6 months and no corrosion or issues from saltwater. I do rinse after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for the $
customer_reviews.text: The Centron is a really nice reel for the $. I have been using a 500 size for a year on an ultralight set up. It's nice when pared with the 4 lb. Kastking Flourokote for trout. This year I added the 2000 size with 6 lb Flourokote on my Diawa Spinnmatic 7 ft ultralight. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple different Kast King reels at the same time and ended up using the other one more--mostly because it's on a nicer rod. Both reels are incredible for the money. They come in better packaging than my reels that cost much more and the quality is on par with (or better than) pretty much anything else I own for fresh water.
customer_reviews.author: xnewyorkhardcorex

customer_reviews.title: Centron 2000
customer_reviews.text: Great little spinng reel for $25! I have used several lines from 6 pound mono to 30 pound braid with a variety of lures and baits and it works great. The action is very smooth, the bail clicks down solid and the line finds the roller every time. I have had very few issues with backlash and line tangles even though this is my first time fishing in 30 years. If you're new to fishing and don't want to invest a fortune in gear then you really can't go wrong with this reel.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Great reel, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great reel, great value! I replaced a more expensive reel, that wore out, with this less expensive KastKing reel and it surpassed my expectations. It reels in smoothly and easily. It also out-casts my previous reel. I have used it for two weeks straight just about every day for 5 hours or so, and it performed flawlessly! No tangles or any issues at all. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Steveco52

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, Beautiful, Light and afordable
customer_reviews.text: I have not made it a practice to write reviews on products. At best, I may give feedback with no to few comments. But the KastKing Centron Spinning Reel demands my attention. First, the design and color choice looks sleek and simply beautiful. It's light, yet feels robust, and the reel cranking is smooth. I feel like I'm taking a vacation. I haven't put it on the water yet, but I can tell by the initial feel it's going to be a favorite reel. Oh, I forgot: it's affordable. BTW: I also purchased the KastKing Perigee II, Fishing Rod.
customer_reviews.author: Roy S. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Good Inexpensive reel.
customer_reviews.text: i picked up the 2000 sized reel to use with an ultralight rod. loaded it with 6LB braid, and set the drag for 2.25 lbs. first time out i landed a 16" largemouth Bass with no problems at all. the one way bearing seems solid, the drag pulls out smoothly and there's nothing inherently wrong with the construction i can find. if you need an inexpensive reel for light duty use this will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Savlaka

customer_reviews.title: cheap construction!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very exited to try this reel. It looks very nice but when tried by the first time noticed the lever wont tie on completely allowing some movement on the handle which intermediately created indentations on the edge of its base. Seem to be some design flaw or poor construction...
customer_reviews.author: Harvest Group Corporation

customer_reviews.title: It has a comfortable handle
customer_reviews.text: This Centron is not a bad reel. I have the 2000 version to replace the Okuma Voyer travel combo reel, and so far it has been great. Granted I have only taken it out 3 times to catch 6"-8" Brook and Rainbow, but it is holding up nicely. The reel is a touch on the heavy side with a really thick bail, but it feels solid like it will laat.
customer_reviews.author: MissKay

customer_reviews.title: Not the most hardy reel...
customer_reviews.text: This whole reel feels like it's made out of cheap aluminum. The bail bent and came loose on the first day out on the water. If you get any heavy fish on this like channel cats, the drag just isn't enough and then when you really crank it tight, it feels super sloppy and binds, often breaking the line (even 25lb test). So if you're looking for a pond reel for your kid, go for it. If you're looking for a reel to do any kind of regular fishing on... Just get an uglystick combo and you'd be better off.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: This is an AMAZING reel! And the customer service is great. I had an issue with the handle cap and they were very courteous and quick to respond. The price is very affordable and the quality is comparable to reels twice the price. I bought this reel and my bf bought one about twice the price... and after a day fishing, we both agreed this was the better reel between the two. His line kept getting tangled from his reel, but this reel never had a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Maren

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year later my go to reel
customer_reviews.text: So I got this reel last year and since then I have landed many big catfish a few decent bass and finally last night a giant gar. This reel handled it all with ease. I must say I am very impressed with this reel so I will be ordering another very soon. If you are looking for a good reel for all situations I'd say go with the Centron.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Smith

customer_reviews.title: lol Just got back from doing a little bass fishing and using this light gear was way more fun than my old rig
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on a Lamiglass light pole and all i can say is Wow this is my new lucky pole! First cast landed a 3lb brown trout. What a fight! lol Just got back from doing a little bass fishing and using this light gear was way more fun than my old rig. Strong enough to land the larger than expected fish and still more play than what I'm used to for the average and small fish.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Okay, maybe
customer_reviews.text: Looking for an inexpensive reel and thought this one would be a good choice. I had a couple of issues regarding the fishing line bird-nesting and even the line getting wrapped up under the spool. What a hassel. Not sure if issue was result of reel or the line, Kastking Fluorokote.
customer_reviews.author: William Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can't go wrong. I'm a big fan of KastKing products and this reel is no exception. Cranks smoothly. Drag is smooth. Holds a lot of line for the spool size. Much lighter than my other similarly priced spinning reel from a different manufacturer, and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: A Good Reel for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Huge step up from my previous reel, which fell apart on its own accord in the middle of a fishing trip. This one, unlike my old reel, is made mostly of metal. The parts that aren’t metal are durable plastic. The anti-reverse is incredibly responsive, and the reeling itself is very smooth. All in all, it’s a very good reel for the price. I’m sure better reels exist, but this one is affordable as well as high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Landis

customer_reviews.title: Great little reel
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Kastking Summer 500 reel and I'm impressed. It cost less than $20 and it's by far the best ultralight spinning reel that I have and it's good looking too. I put 6lb mono and I like how easy it cast and how smooth it is when retrieving. I use it only for panfish like bluegill. So far I'm very happy with this reel and I highly recommend it. Great job Kastking.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel71

customer_reviews.title: Good value reel
customer_reviews.text: We are lazy and often leave our gear outside in the weather for weeks at a time. We do not live near salt water, but the reel has held up with no signs of corrosion and works smooth. My only complaint would be that there are some plastic pieces to the reel, but at this price point, that is expected. Nothing has broken on it thus far.
customer_reviews.author: adam hooper

customer_reviews.title: Beginner fisherman had a great summer!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for a lake fishing trip in Minnesota and it was great! No issues with reeling and casting at all. I had a great time with the reel and it was the perfect size for walleye and northern. I was using 20/8 lb test SpiderWire Stealth Superline Braided Fishing Line with it. Caught some big ol northerns who were really tugging hard on the reel. Setting tension was easy. I am looking forward to my next fishing trip with this reel.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Brasky

customer_reviews.title: Great product, every fisherman should give it a try
customer_reviews.text: what a amazing reel!!! I bought two of 2000,3000 and 5000 series, first try on 2000 paired with light action rod and 8lb fluorokote (also phenomenal product), luckily I got a almost 9lb largemouth which is the biggest one I ever caught, the reel handled no tiny issue, feels even better than my Daiwa fuego (5 times higher price). After all, it's a great product at great price range with attactive design, good job! Kastking
customer_reviews.author: L.Wang

customer_reviews.title: Don’t pay a fortune for name brand reels when this one will exceed your expectations
customer_reviews.text: For the price I cannot find a reel that is better, ultra smooth. First use I was crappie fishing and landed a 7 pound channel cat. Took me forever to land it as I only had 4pound test. Why pay $100 for a reel when this one does the job, just as good. Looks nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Powellstinger

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, plasticky, heavy reel...
customer_reviews.text: Im a avid fisherman and I often purchase Kastking products through Amazon and considering this reel was so highly reviewed and was only $25, I went ahead and decided to purchase this reel. One of the first thing I noticed about this reel it has a pretty good drag system but all in all it feels heavy, cheap and plasticky. Casting with this reel was not as smooth as I would had hope for, and couldn't cast as far as i wanted. At the end, i decided to return it for my money back. Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: psx

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different reel
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell if mine is simply defective or not but I bought the ice fishing reel and it spools evenly enough but reeling it back in is uneven. It reels in more on the bottom and leaves it looking like a cone. Also I've bird nested twice with two entirely different lines.
customer_reviews.author: Syed Warsi

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought they would be
customer_reviews.text: Someone broke into the rod and reel storage of my boat and stole all my Crappie poles and reels I liked. Bought new rods and put these reels on them for an upcoming tournament. They were smooth and worked just the way I wanted. I’ll buy Moore for the price
customer_reviews.author: rwm

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have the 2500 version of the Kastking Centron and love it. I wanted to dip my toe in the water with their entry level reel and it is clear the attention to detail is present throughout the spectrum of their products. This rig casts well, has a very smooth retrieval, and the general heft of it feels sturdy and well made. I agree with other review about the size of the bail, but do not find that to be a significant factor when casting it. Can't wait to try out one of their bait casters next.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McClane

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Gosh, for less than $30 bucks...I didn't really expect much. Its better than my Shimano Sahara I paid $80 for it. I got a nice 22" stripe bass around 5 lb with on my 1st day of trying the reel. I'm really amazed. The down side is it stated at 9.3 oz but I feel heavier than that..haha..
customer_reviews.author: PeterSea

customer_reviews.title: Great quality reel. Centron 2000
customer_reviews.text: Since I could not find this reel in a store near me, I decided to buy this reel online based on reviews. Compared to what I saw in stores, it is comparable to reels in the $60-$70 based on quality and smooth movement. I did take it out to the lake the next day and it performed very well in very windy conditions and have been amazing ever since. I use an 8ft rod for long casting and it worked great! I highly recommend this reel because, in its price range, it much much higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This reel is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: (Centron3000) This reel is amazing. First, it does not break the bank! It handles like a 60$ reel. Light weight and supper smooth. I took this reel out and tested it on some really nice fish. The two biggest top out at 7 and 8 pounds. the reel handled flawlessly and needles to say i am very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: LovingMontana

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for 3 fishing seasons and I've had no issues. I do very little to no upkeep on this reel. Had it submerged a few times when fishing. I've caught alot of bass with it. Definitely worth the money for me. It was my first of many kastking products
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Caught my PB large mouth with this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because Extreme Philly Fishing guy was using it. Nabbed my biggest large mouth (not shown) with the 3000 series. Dude...let me tell you, I set the drag and it really helped land that monster. I think I am going to buy the 500 series. Looks cool, smooth and fish love it. This one not bad either. I took this to the dog park and I got more attention than the bros with the little puppies.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member SS

customer_reviews.title: otherwise great reel for a great deal
customer_reviews.text: Heavy for it's size...otherwise great reel for a great deal! Edit 12/8/2018 Used this reel for saltwater inshore fishing about a dozen times now. It does not have great water resistance, but did a teardown and regrease and it's still like new. If you dont maintain your reels I wouldn't recommend using this for salt, but if you do then this is a fantastic deal.
customer_reviews.author: gfang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product giving you a smooth and versatile feel that you would only expect in a reel that is 2 or 3 times more expensi.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome reel at the price point or really any price point. I caught a large number of salmon with this reel. In the past I have tried other reels but I found the one major issue with the other reels was the amount of line you could put on them. This reel is smooth and versatile with the ability to put more than enough line to get you through a long day of fishing.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this little real
customer_reviews.text: I put this real on an ultralight rod for Crappie fishing and it works great. Love the folding handle as it helps me store it on the rod holder. I have nothing but praises for the real. Actually caught a 7 pound stripper on it and it held up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Langston

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a nice little reel
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a nice little reel. I've used it once, and reeled in a couple of medium catfish with it. Feels like good quality, and I especially like that the spool can stop anywhere (whereas some of my old reels only had a couple of places the spool/bail could stop, and I would often have to let it go backwards to get to that spot).
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly knob
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had it that long but seems like it was worth 30. One thing that does suck is the drag adjustment knob, Even all the way the knob doesn’t sit fully in spool and is wobbly, when starting a retrieve and loose, line can start wrapping up inbetween knob and spool. Kast King please respond or ima take this thing apart and count bearings!
customer_reviews.author: jmar

customer_reviews.title: About what you would expect for $23.00
customer_reviews.text: Reel seems to work ok.. Reel handle has an injection molded knob. The seams where the mold for the knob came together still have raised, kinda sharp, uneven edges that make the handle uncomfortable. This is the case on both reels that I ordered(2000 and 3000). I would much rather preferred a foam or rubber knob that is comfortable and paid an extra dollar or two for the reel. Other than that they seem pretty smooth. In the future, I’ll probably go back to paying 37.00 for an Okuma Ceymar, which is much smoother and more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bob K

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget Bass fishing Reel.
customer_reviews.text: I really love the smoothness of this reel. For the price compared to the components its unbeatable. I have been using it for Bass fishing and they dont stand a chance. The drag system is the star feature for me. I actually first bought the 500 size and caught a 3lb. bass no problem to my suprise and the 3000 size reel brings them in without any issue at all no matter the size. Trust me this is the smoothest reel for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tunstills

customer_reviews.title: Great reviews but.....
customer_reviews.text: Having opened the product and inspecting,I felt initial quality was boastful.Very scratchy while reeling throughout the unit.could be nothing,but I just purchased a 3 bearing shimano that was much better standard,However ,I like the Look it has and the bail mechanism is something shimano should adopt.much beefier.The product did not gain my confidence in initial quality so I returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: don doyle

customer_reviews.title: What’s not to like?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used this for a few days but so far I love it! Can’t beat it for the price! It’s nice and smooth both casting and reeling. I spooled it w 15lb high vis braid and don’t want to put it down! Makes me wanna try a KastKing rod! Maybe Christmas or Father’s Day?!
customer_reviews.author: chris331

customer_reviews.title: Reel is smooth but line coming off reel whips rod badly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 5000 series reel. This reel does not cast 20 lb mono very well. I spooled up with 20 lb p-line floroclear and could not cast past 135 feet. I'll probably keep this reel for salmon or steelhead in the fall. The pole I mounted it on was a 7 foot pengree II from KastKing. I will spooled it with Braid and call it done. The line whipping the polewith mono was drastically slowing it down the heavy lures when casting.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Westhoff

customer_reviews.title: Reviews are misleading.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have anything bad to say about this reel but the reviews seem to state it is a great . One review was comparing it equal to the Pfluger president series. That is why I purchased it and that was a mistake. It is nowhere near the quality of the Pfluger. It's closer to the quality of what you get with any cheap name brand rod reel combo. It's worth what you pay for it but I would rather spend twice the money and get something 4 times the quality.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

product_meta.title: KastKing Summer and Centron Spinning Reels, 9 +1 BB Light Weight, Ultra Smooth Powerful, Size 500 is Perfect for Ultralight/Ice Fishing.
feature_bullets: GREAT VALUE - Loaded with features yet low on price. KastKing Summer/Centron offers the best value...at any level. The KastKing Summer Fishing Reel turns any angler into a PRO.

LIGHTWEIGHT - narrow graphite frame design and computer balancing system combined with high performance in the compact Spinning Reel makes KastKing Summer/Centron an awesome gift for anybody who loves fishing.

HIGH POWERED - KastKing Summer/Centron spinning reel's Superior Drag System offers incredible stopping power up to 17.5LBs. It has a hardened metal main shaft, perfect mesh drive gear and precision machined pinion gear for fish fighting power.
SMOOTH PERFORMANCE - Summer/Centron's nine quality ball bearings and one instant stop one-way anti-reverse bearing give it ultra-smooth performance.

LOOKING GOOD - Summer/Centron's attractive, brilliant finish and its high strength two color anodized aluminum spool, with a power launch lip for farther casting, holds more line than competitor's models that sell for much more.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
